Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Out of a total of 105 awards, 30 scholarships provide full tuition fee coverage, while the remaining 75 scholarships cover 50% of the tuition fees.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full or 50% tuition fee waiver.
*   Exemption from other appropriate compulsory fees as determined by the institutions.
*   Economy class air-ticket from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/domicile to Brunei Darussalam prior to the commencement of the course, and an economy class air-ticket for the return journey upon completion of the program.
*   Monthly allowance.
*   On-campus accommodation.
Quantity: A total of 105 scholarships are awarded annually, comprising 30 fully funded scholarships and 75 scholarships covering 50% of tuition fees.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students/foreign students from all countries. Applicants must intend to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, or Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs. Studies can be undertaken at Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).
Eligible_Fields: Art History, Design, Product Design, Fashion Design, Film Studies, Music, Theater Arts, Agricultural Sciences, Forest Sciences, Biology, Life Sciences, Biomedicine, Chemistry, Environmental Science, Food Science, Marine Science, Lacustrine Science, Mathematics, Physics, Aeronautical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Hydro Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Sustainable Energy Technologies, Renewable Energy, Islamic Studies, Business Administration, Business Management, Anthropology, Development Studies, Food Security, Gender Studies, Gender and Development Studies, Global Affairs, International Affairs, International Relations, Globalization, History, Journalism, Linguistics, Media Studies, Digital Media, Peace Studies, Mediation, Conflict Research, Sociology
Eligible_Field_Group: ARTS & DESIGN, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, STEM - ENGINEERING, Other, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES
Experience_Years: Professional and personal leadership attributes, including relevant work experience, are considered. Applicants from Nigeria must have at least two (2) years of post-qualification or employment practice.
Language_Certificate: A Credit 6 at GCE 'O' Level Examination, A Grade 'C' in IGCSE English (as a second language), An IELTS score of 6.0
Special_Circumstances: Scholarship recipients are strictly prohibited from undertaking any paid employment or serving on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the entire scholarship duration. Upon successful completion of their program, scholarship recipients are required to leave Brunei Darussalam immediately and return to their country of origin.
Career_Plan: Applicants must submit an essay of up to 200 words describing their proposed plan of study and/or research, and how it relates to their future career aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Reference letters are required. Applicants interested in Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must complete an additional online application through UBD's admission portal. All applicants from Nigeria must have completed their National Youth Service Corps (N.Y.S.C.).
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship (BDGS) is a prestigious annual award scheme designed to attract international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at leading higher education institutions in Brunei Darussalam. For the 2025/2026 academic session, the scholarship aims to provide opportunities for foreign students to study in various disciplines, contributing to Brunei Darussalam's interests.
Application_Documents:
Online Application Form (BDGS Application Form)
Reference Letter(s)
Essay/Personal Statement (Career Plan)
Timeline:
Applications are now open for the 2025/2026 academic session : Application Opening Date
15th February 2025 at 16:00 hrs (Brunei time) : Application Deadline
late 2025 : Notification of Results

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark)
Funding_Details:
This is a fully funded scholarship providing comprehensive financial support. It offers an exceptional opportunity for international students to study in Denmark for free, covering significant educational and living costs.
*   Full tuition fees for the Master's program at SDU.
*   A monthly stipend to support living expenses.
While comprehensive, the scholarship does not cover all potential costs. Applicants should be aware that certain extra expenses, such as application fees (if any, though SDU's scholarship application is integrated with admission), and other personal costs, may need to be covered by the student.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be an international student from a non-EU/EEA country. Some programs also specify eligibility for students from outside Switzerland. Applicants must be highly qualified and high-achieving students with an excellent academic background. Must have been accepted into an eligible Master's degree program at the University of Southern Denmark. Must complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen Master's program at SDU. For SDU, a separate scholarship application is generally not needed, as the admission application serves this purpose.
Eligible_Fields: Aeronautical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Hydro Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Sustainable Energy Technologies, Renewable Energy
Min_Gpa: A weighted grade point average of at least 8.2 on the Danish 7-point grading scale or 9 on an unspecified scale. Some sources also mention a minimum GPA of 2.0, which may refer to a different grading scale.
Language_Certificate: English proficiency comparable to the Danish B level in English. This can be proven through: A TOEFL score of 575 (paper-based), 230 (computer-based), or 88 (internet-based). One source explicitly states "no IELTS needed," though official SDU admission requirements for specific programs should be consulted for definitive language test policies.
Special_Circumstances: Successful graduates from public universities in Denmark may also be eligible for a 3-year post-study work visa, offering a pathway to work and settle in the country. Campus Restrictions: Scholarships can only be awarded for programs offered on the Vejle campus, though other sources mention specific Master's degree programs at the Sønderborg campus as eligible. Applicants should verify program and campus eligibility directly with SDU.
Scholarship_Info: The Danish Government Scholarship at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU) offers a fully funded opportunity for highly qualified international students from non-EU/EEA countries to pursue Master's degree programs in engineering. Provided by the Danish Government through the Ministry of Higher Education and Science, this scholarship aims to acknowledge the significant contribution of overseas students and support their educational pursuits in Denmark. It enables recipients to study in a leading research environment at SDU, recognized as one of the world's top 50 universities. The scholarship is highly competitive, with a limited number of awards granted based on academic merit, primarily GPA.
Application_Documents:
The application process for the scholarship is integrated with the admission application for the Master's program at SDU. Required documents typically include:
*   Online admission application for the chosen Master's program via the SDU portal.
*   Motivation letter.
*   Reference letters.
*   Academic transcripts and degree certificates.
*   Proof of English language proficiency.
A separate scholarship application form is generally not required for SDU, as eligibility is assessed based on the admission application.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Chulalongkorn University Thai Government Scholarship is a fully funded program, offering extensive financial support to cover all expenses for the duration of the study. There is no application fee for this scholarship.

Covered Expenses Include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of all academic tuition costs.
*   Monthly Stipend: Approximately 16,000 Baht per month to support living and housing expenses. One source also mentions "$9877 stipends," which may refer to an annual total or a less precise conversion.
*   Accommodation: Covered as part of the living expenses.
*   Return Flights: Economy class airfare is covered, with the amount of reimbursement varying based on the applicant’s home location.
*   Meals: Included in the financial support.
*   Allowance: General allowance provided.
*   Books: Financial support for academic materials.
*   Transport: Coverage for local transportation.
*   Thesis Support: Financial assistance for thesis-related activities.
*   Research Support: Funding for research endeavors.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance is provided.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The scholarship is open to a broad international applicant pool, with specific conditions:
*   Nationality: Open to international students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries (all around the world).
*   Study Level: Applicants must intend to pursue graduate studies (Master's or PhD) at Chulalongkorn University.
*   Prior Study Restriction: Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: All fields, Information Studies, International Business, Business Management
Experience_Years: For applicants to MBA programs, a minimum of one year of relevant work experience is required.
Language_Certificate:
Applicants must demonstrate a good command of English, meeting the minimum English score requirements of their respective chosen program. This can be evidenced by:
*   A certificate of English proficiency from the applicant’s prior university.
*   Results from standardized tests such as TOEFL (minimum score 500) or IELTS (minimum score 5.0).
Special_Circumstances: Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
Other_Requirements:
Two Recommendation Letters are required for both Master's and PhD applicants.
A valid Passport Copy.
A Medical Certificate confirming good health.
Applicants must be in good health to attend a degree program.
Scholarship_Info: The Chulalongkorn University Thai Government Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded graduate scholarship program designed for international students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries worldwide. Offered by Thailand's oldest and most esteemed university, Chulalongkorn University, this scholarship aims to provide comprehensive financial assistance for Master's and PhD degree programs across a wide range of academic fields.
Application_Documents:
All required application documents must be completed and merged into a single PDF file for submission. These include:
*   Valid Passport Copy
*   Medical Certificate (confirming good health)
*   Two Recommendation Letters (for Master's and Ph.D. applicants)
*   Scholarship Request form
*   Proposal & Schedule of Plan
*   Accepted Letter from Host University (if applicable)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   **Monthly Stipend:** A competitive monthly stipend, which can be up to 9000 TL per month, is provided to admitted students.
*   **Tuition Fee:** Full coverage of university tuition fees.
*   **Return Flight Ticket:** A one-time return flight ticket to Turkey at the beginning of the study and back to the home country upon graduation.
*   **Health Insurance:** Comprehensive health insurance coverage.
*   **Accommodation:** Provision of accommodation for scholarship recipients.
*   **Turkish Language Course:** All scholarship recipients are required to take a one-year Turkish language course before commencing their academic program, even if their degree program is taught in English. This is a crucial component for cultural integration and academic success.
Quantity: Approximately 5,000 new scholarships are awarded annually
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must fulfill specific requirements detailed during the application period. Short-term scholarship programs may have additional application requirements. Generally targets outstanding international students.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not specified, but relevant experiences significantly strengthen an application
Language_Certificate: Specific language tests (e.g., TOEFL IBT 75) may be required for some programs; all recipients must take a one-year Turkish language course
Age: Undergraduate: Under 21, Master's: Under 30, PhD: Under 35, Research: Under 50
Career_Plan: Required as part of personal statement/letter of intent
Other_Requirements: At least one letter of recommendation; Personal Statement/Letter of Intent; Short-term scholarship programs may have additional specific requirements
Scholarship_Info: Türkiye Scholarships (Türkiye Bursları) is a prestigious international scholarship program funded by the Government of Turkey. It aims to attract outstanding international students to pursue full-time or short-term academic programs at top Turkish universities, strengthening educational and cultural ties. It is the largest Turkish scholarship program for international students.
Application_Documents:
*   National Identity Card (CNIC) or Passport
*   Letter(s) of Recommendation
*   Personal Statement/Letter of Intent
*   Academic Credentials (transcripts, diplomas)
*   Resume/Curriculum Vitae (detailing academic achievements, research projects, internships, work experiences, publications, and presentations)
*   Any other documents specified by the scholarship provider.
Timeline:
January 10 : Applications Open
February 20 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Tuition-free education: All tuition fees are fully covered for the duration of the scholarship.
- Monthly stipend:
    - For Bachelor’s, Master’s, One-tier Master’s, Non-degree, and Postgraduate specialist training courses: HUF 43,700 (approximately EUR 103) per month.
    - For PhD programmes: HUF 140,000 (approximately EUR 365) per month for the first 4 semesters (first phase), and HUF 180,000 (approximately EUR 470) per month for the second 4 semesters (second phase).
    - Stipends are paid for 12 months a year until the completion of studies.
- Accommodation contribution: Scholarship holders receive a free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000 per month towards accommodation costs.
- Medical insurance: Comprehensive medical insurance coverage is provided up to HUF 65,000 (approximately EUR 160) annually.
- Important Considerations: The scholarship is designed to cover the living expenses of one person only; it does not include financing or visa exemption for accompanying family members. Scholarship holders are advised that they may need to supplement the provided funds with their own financial resources to cover all living expenses in Hungary.
Quantity: Not specified for 2025/2026; over 4,900 awarded in 2020/2021.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to foreign students from almost 80 countries worldwide. Applicants must be certified full-time students and apply through their country's designated Sending Partner. Eligibility for specific scholarship types and study fields, as well as available scientific fields and education levels, are determined by bilateral educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and the applicant's Sending Partner country, and can vary significantly by country.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Master's degree, Master's equivalent
Min_Gpa: Not explicitly stated for initial application. To retain scholarship: 3.0/5.0 or 2.5/4.0. For State-Funded Support Program: 4.0/5.0 (equivalent to B).
Language_Certificate: Proof of language proficiency for the language of instruction (typically English or Hungarian) is required. Accepted proofs include internationally recognized certificates such as FCE, CAE, IELTS (minimum 5.5+), or TOEFL (minimum 69+ for general programs). For specific programs like MA English Studies, higher TOEFL scores (95-120) may be required. A CEFR B2-level English certificate is also generally accepted. Alternatively, if previous studies were conducted entirely in the language of the selected program, proof of this can be submitted instead of a standardized language test.
Age: Minimum 18 years old by August 31 of commencement year. No upper age limit by program, but check with Sending Partner.
Special_Circumstances: The Students at Risk Subprogramme is available for eligible individuals. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders are eligible to reapply for a higher academic level. Applicants without a passport can upload a declaration along with their national ID. For partial (exchange) study programmes, a certificate confirming student status from the applicant's current higher education institution is required, verifying that the student status is expected to exist during the partial studies.
Career_Plan: Applicants are strongly advised to reflect on their academic and career goals and articulate how the Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship will facilitate the achievement of these objectives. This is typically conveyed through a well-crafted motivation letter.
Other_Requirements: If recommended by a Hungarian Host Institution, a recommendation letter may be required. Some Sending Partners (e.g., Pakistan's HEC) require additional online applications through their national scholarship portal. Certain countries (e.g., Kazakhstan) may require a commitment to return and work in the home country after studies. Scholarship holders are permitted to work for not more than 30 hours a week during the teaching period. Internship opportunities are available and sometimes required, often published through the Alumni Network Hungary.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum is a prestigious Hungarian Government Scholarship Programme, officially launched in 2013. It is managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by the Tempus Public Foundation. The scholarship aims to attract top foreign students to pursue higher education in Hungary, fostering international academic and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
- Scanned copy of secondary school graduation certificate or equivalent (for Bachelor's/One-tier Master's/Non-degree Hungarian language preparatory programmes).
- Scanned copy of Bachelor’s degree certificate or equivalent (for Master's programmes).
- Scanned copy of 17/18 years degree or equivalent (for PhD programmes).
- Certificate of student status from current higher education institution (for partial/exchange study programmes).
- Proof of language proficiency.
- Motivation letter.
- Declaration and national ID (if passport is not yet available).
- All documents not originally in English or Hungarian must be accompanied by an official translation.
Timeline:

February 2025 : Nomination by Sending Partners

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The Chinese Government Scholarship offers either full or partial funding. A full scholarship is comprehensive, covering a tuition waiver, accommodation (typically a free university dormitory or lodging allowance), a monthly stipend, and comprehensive medical insurance. Partial scholarships cover a subset of these expenses. Beyond these core benefits, the scholarship may also cover education costs, administration costs, health insurance, and expenditures to support student activities. For specific programs like the AASCU-designated scholarship, the value can be approximately 10,000 USD, disbursed directly to the Chinese universities rather than individual students.

The funding duration varies significantly by the program and academic level:
*   Overall: Up to 7 years, which can include up to 2 years of Chinese language tuition if required.
*   Bachelor's Degree: 4 academic years (5 academic years for medicine majors).
*   Master's Degree: 2 to 3 academic years.
*   Doctoral Degree: 3 academic years.
*   General Scholar Programs (non-degree): Up to 1 academic year for HSK winner scholarships.
Quantity: Over 35,000 scholarships are awarded to international students annually.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The Chinese Government Scholarship is broadly accessible, open to students from over 170 countries, with some programs open to all nationalities. It supports both short-term and long-term study at over 250 to 280+ designated Chinese universities.
Specific eligibility requirements may apply to certain programs:
*   Silk Road Program: Targets nationals of countries participating in China's 'One Belt One Road' initiative.
*   AASCU-designated Program: For students enrolled at AASCU member institutions.
*   University of Minnesota Program: Specifically for University of Minnesota undergraduates or graduate students.
*   Chinese University Programs (Postgraduate): Generally open to all nationalities.
Applicants must not have completed their previous study within China, or if they did, at least one year must have passed since its completion.
Eligible_Fields: Agricultural Sciences, Forest Sciences, Biology, Life Sciences, Biomedicine, Chemistry, Environmental Science, Food Science, Marine Science, Lacustrine Science, Mathematics, Physics, Aeronautical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Hydro Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Sustainable Energy Technologies, Renewable Energy, Clinical Medicine, Dentistry, Deglutology, Epidemiology, Global Health, Health Economics, Health Policy, Health Management, Medicine, Pharmacy, Public Health, Sexual Health, Reproductive Health, Economics, Commercial Law, Human Rights Law, International Law, Law, Rule of Law, Transnational Justice, Philosophy, Education Management, Educational Administration, Psychology of Education, TESOL, Learning, Education and Technology, Literature, History, Business Administration, Business Management, International Management, Strategic Marketing Management, Environmental Management, Disaster Risk Management
Eligible_Field_Group: STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, STEM - ENGINEERING, HEALTH & MEDICINE, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS, LAW, POLITICS & GOVERNANCE, EDUCATION, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, INTERDISCIPLINARY & SPECIALIZED
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: At least three years of experience (work experience, professional training, or a related educational or working background)
Language_Certificate: Chinese-Taught Programs: HSK Level 3 (Undergraduate/General Scholar), HSK 4 (score of at least 180) for Master's/PhD. Chinese language instruction certificate accepted if previous degree was Chinese-taught. English-Taught Programs: TOEFL and IELTS scores generally accepted. CSCA (Chinese Scholarship Council Admission Test) may be required for September 2026 enrollment.
Age: General Scholar Programs: Under 45 years old; HSK Winner Scholarship: Under 40 years old; Master's Programs: Under 35 years old; Doctoral Programs: Under 40 years old
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must not have completed their previous study within China, or if they did, at least one year must have passed since its completion. Awardees may not concurrently hold overlapping Chinese government-funded scholarships. Specific programs target nationals of countries participating in China's 'One Belt One Road' initiative (Silk Road Program), students enrolled at AASCU member institutions (AASCU-designated Program), or University of Minnesota undergraduates or graduate students (University of Minnesota Program).
Career_Plan: A detailed study plan of at least 1,500 words is required. Doctoral students must also submit a research proposal signed by their prospective Chinese supervisor.
Other_Requirements: Two letters of recommendation (written in Chinese or English, from professors or associate professors) are mandatory for graduate programs or senior scholar programs. Applicants planning to stay in China for more than 6 months must submit a photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form, completed in English. All applicants must provide a pre-admission document issued by the universities to which they are applying.
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious program officially known as the "Chinese Government Scholarship," designed to support international students pursuing academic studies in China. It is primarily provided by the Chinese Government, administered through the China Scholarship Council (CSC) under the Chinese Ministry of Education, and supports study at over 250-280+ designated Chinese universities through various channels including Bilateral Programs, the EU Window, the Silk Road Program, and Chinese University Programs.
Application_Documents:
Required documents for online submission (in PDF format, no hard copies unless specified by the university) include:
*   CSC Application Form (downloaded after online application).
*   Two letters of recommendation.
*   Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
*   HSK reports (if applicable).
*   Pre-admission document from a Chinese university.
*   Study plan (at least 1,500 words).
*   Doctoral proposal signed by the Chinese supervisor (for PhD applicants).
*   Chinese language instruction certificate (if previous degree was Chinese-taught).
*   Official documents containing the applicant's English name, gender, and nationality.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Full tuition coverage for the chosen postgraduate program.
- Monthly stipends equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages, intended to cover living expenses.
- Health insurance.
- Visa fees.
- A one-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card.
- Immigration support.
Eligibility_Criteria: Be a foreign citizen from any nationality. Must not hold dual Colombian nationality. Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last 6 months prior to applying. Applicants must also not have started studies in Colombia at the time of application. Must not have been a previous beneficiary of the ICETEX Beca Colombia program. Must hold a professional or bachelor’s degree. Candidates must be between 25 and 49 years old. The scholarship specifically targets high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership potential.
Experience_Years: at least 1 year of professional experience
Language_Certificate: TOEFL iBT, TOEFL ITP, Academic IELTS are required. Bridging English Language Training available for IELTS score 0.5 below entry requirement. Spanish language support provided for non-Spanish-speaking countries.
Special_Circumstances: Explicitly open to applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries, with provisions for Spanish language skill development.
Other_Requirements: Meeting all academic, language, and documentation requirements is crucial for a successful application. No application fee required.
Scholarship_Info: The Colombia Government Scholarship, officially known as Beca Colombia, is a prestigious fully funded scholarship program for international students, administered by the Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad (ICETEX). This initiative is part of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, designed to promote higher education, international cooperation, and strengthen social, academic, cultural, and technological ties. It offers comprehensive financial and academic support for foreign citizens pursuing postgraduate studies (Specialization, Master's, or Ph.D.) at public and private higher education institutions across Colombia. The scholarship targets high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership potential, particularly welcoming applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries.
Application_Documents:
- Verified copies of Educational Transcripts.
- University certificate-transcript (in English or Spanish) certifying the applicant's average grade point from their bachelor's degree.
- Recent academic letter of reference from a university professor (dated 2019 or later).
- An online application form.
- Foreign candidates are advised to carefully read the call for applications and submit only the required documents to ICETEX.

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Details:
A €10,000 stipend for one academic year.
A full tuition fee waiver from the host Irish institution.
Applicants are explicitly advised that they must ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover other living costs and expenses while studying in Ireland, beyond what the scholarship provides.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Must be an outstanding non-EU/EEA student, with a domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom. This means applicants must be international, fee-paying students.
Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10) at the time of applying for the scholarship. The offer letter must confirm the applicant's status as an international, fee-paying student pursuing a full-time postgraduate program for at least one year.
Applicants who have previously received a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again.
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional or research experience are prescribed. Prior experience is a primary assessment criterion.
Language_Certificate: IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates are required only if mandated by the applicant's chosen host institution. The GOI-IES scholarship itself does not independently mandate these tests.
Career_Plan: Applicants are expected to articulate their long-term goals and aspirations, often through their personal statement or essay questions, which are key components of the application.
Other_Requirements:
Must be an international, fee-paying student.
Must possess a valid offer letter from an eligible Irish institution at the time of applying for the scholarship.
The program must be full-time and at the specified postgraduate levels (NFQ levels 9 or 10).
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious and highly competitive initiative designed to attract top-tier international students from non-EU/EEA countries to pursue postgraduate studies in Ireland. The program awards 60 scholarships annually, aiming to enhance Ireland's international education profile and foster academic excellence among global students.
Application_Documents:
Academic transcripts and marksheets.
Recommendation letters (references).
Personal statement/Statement of Purpose.
Responses to essay questions.
Copy of passport.
Valid offer letter from an eligible Irish higher education institution.
Applicants are also advised to consult the GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, and Application Help Document available on the official website.
Timeline:
Applications for the 2025/2026 academic year are open.
5 March 2025 : Application Deadline
Scholarships are for one year of full-time study during the 2025/2026 academic year.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The scholarship is described as a fully-funded opportunity, covering tuition fees and providing a generous grant for living expenses.
Recipients receive a grant of either €10,000 or €10,020 per academic year, in addition to a full tuition fee waiver.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Living expenses (through the annual grant)
Eligibility_Criteria: Candidates must not hold Belgian nationality. Must be an outstanding student from anywhere in the world. Must apply to and be accepted by a Flemish higher education institution for an eligible Master's degree program; acceptance by the host institution is a prerequisite. The previous degree (used for Master's admission) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution for a degree program are not eligible to apply.
Eligible_Fields: Anthropology, Development Studies, Food Security, Gender Studies, Gender and Development Studies, Global Affairs, International Affairs, International Relations, Globalization, History, Journalism, Linguistics, Media Studies, Digital Media, Peace Studies, Mediation, Conflict Research, Sociology, Agricultural Sciences, Forest Sciences, Biology, Life Sciences, Biomedicine, Chemistry, Environmental Science, Food Science, Marine Science, Lacustrine Science, Mathematics, Physics, Aeronautical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Hydro Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Sustainable Energy Technologies, Renewable Energy, Advanced Technologies, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Data Science, Digital Technologies, Machine Learning, Robotics
Eligible_Field_Group: SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, STEM - ENGINEERING, STEM - COMPUTER SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY
Language_Certificate: Online language tests of IELTS (IELTS Indicator) and TOEFL (TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition) are accepted as proof of English language proficiency. Other language certificates may also be accepted depending on the host institution's requirements.
Special_Circumstances: International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on a credit mobility program (such as Erasmus+) are still eligible.
Career_Plan: Required as part of motivation letter
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters are required. A motivation letter is mandatory, explaining academic goals, career aspirations, and why the applicant deserves the scholarship. Preparatory programs are not eligible. Distance learning programs are not eligible. Specific Master's programs may also be excluded by individual host institutions; applicants should check with their chosen university.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship program aims to attract outstanding international students from all over the world to pursue Master's degree programs in Flanders and Brussels. It is a prestigious award from the Government of Flanders designed to attract and support academically outstanding international students pursuing Master's degrees in the region.
Application_Documents:
A complete application for an eligible Master’s program at a Flemish host university.
A Master Mind Candidacy Form (often specific to the host institution, e.g., KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Fixed Amount, Other Costs, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation
Funding_Details:
The Tianjin Government Scholarship is described by some sources as "fully funded," offering comprehensive financial assistance to cover various study-related expenses. The specific benefits and funding levels can vary depending on the program, degree level, and potentially the "prize type" (first prize or second prize).

Key Funding Details:
*   General Stipend: Up to CNY 2000 per month.
*   Master's Degree Stipend: CNY 1700 per month.
*   Annual Award (Master's/Doctoral): CNY 10,000 per year for Master’s degree students and CNY 10,000 per year for Doctoral degree students. This may represent a tuition waiver or a separate annual grant.
*   Insurance: Comprehensive insurance coverage worth CNY 800 per year.
*   One-Time Allowance: CNY 800 for new students.

Covered Expenses:
The scholarship typically covers essential expenses during the student's time at the university, including:
*   Tuition fees
*   Materials
*   Accommodation
*   Other study-related expenses
*   Comprehensive insurance
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens. Candidates must be in good physical and mental health. The scholarship is open to both prospective students applying for admission and current self-funded international students already enrolled at eligible universities in Tianjin. Applicants must be applying for or currently enrolled in undergraduate, master's, or doctoral programs at higher education institutions in Tianjin that are eligible to enroll international students. Applicants must be self-funded international students.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: High School Applicants: 80% or above; College/University Applicants: 3.0 or above; MBA Program: 3.2/4.0
Experience_Years: At least one year of work experience is required for applicants to the MBA program.
Language_Certificate: HSK-5 certificates with a minimum score of 180 for Chinese-instructed programs (other Chinese learning and examination certificates may also be accepted). English Proficiency Certificates for English-instructed programs; for the MBA program, specific scores like IELTS 6.5 or TOEFL 85 are mentioned. Applicants must meet the language requirements of their chosen higher education institution.
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship is a one-year duration award, which can be applied for annually. Applicants must be self-funded international students.
Career_Plan: A comprehensive Personal Statement is required, detailing the study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths. It must be written in Chinese or English, with a minimum length of 800 words for Master's and Doctoral degree applications, and no less than 300 words for Bachelor's degree applications. Applicants are advised to use clear and concise language.
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters are mandatory for applicants pursuing master's or doctoral degree studies and senior scholar programs. All application documents must be submitted in English or Chinese.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious financial aid program established by the Tianjin Government in China. It is specifically designed to attract talented international students from around the world to pursue higher education in Tianjin, one of China's largest and most rapidly developing cities. The scholarship aims to provide an outstanding opportunity for recipients to receive an internationally respected education and immerse themselves in China's rich culture and academic excellence. Its purpose is to promote the development of higher education for international students, improve talent cultivation, scientific research, social service, and cultural exchange in Tianjin.
Application_Documents:
1. Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form: Signed by the applicant. For some universities, this is part of an online application system registration.
2. Personal Statement: Including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths (in Chinese or English; min. 800 words for Master/Doctor, min. 300 words for Bachelor).
3. Admission Letter: (If already pre-admitted or for current students).
4. Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201).
5. Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy): Also referred to as the Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
6. Passport: With a validity period of six months or more.
7. Original No Crime Certificate: Also known as a Police Clearance Certificate.
8. Chinese or English Proficiency Certificate: (e.g., HSK-5 with 180, IELTS 6.5, TOEFL 85, or other relevant proofs).
9. Study Experience Resume.
10. Recommendation Letters: Two letters for Master's, Doctoral, and Senior Scholar programs.
11. High School Certificate: Required for bachelor's degree applicants.
12. Copy of Applicant’s Residence Permit: If applicable (for current students in Tianjin).
*All documents must be in English or Chinese.*
Timeline:
October 15, 2024 : Application Opening Date (for Tianjin University)
May 31, 2025 : Application Deadline (for Tianjin University, Bachelor and Master programs)
June 30, 2025 : Application Deadline (for Tianjin Normal University)
July 1 - August 31 : Admission results announced and official documents dispatched (Tianjin University)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Recipients typically receive:
*   Tuition Fee Waivers: Full or partial tuition fee exemptions for enrollment in Italian universities and institutions. However, tuition and enrollment fees are required for advanced Italian language and culture courses, as exemptions do not apply to these specific programs.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly allowance of €900 to cover living expenses.
*   Health and Medical Insurance: Comprehensive health, medical, and accident insurance coverage, contracted by MAECI, for the entire duration of the grant.
Quantity: The specific number of awards is not publicly disclosed but is determined by the MAECI annually.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to foreign citizens not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required for enrollment in the chosen Italian University or Institute. Strict age limits apply, with exceptions only for renewals: Bachelor’s Degree applicants must not exceed 23 years of age; Master’s Degree, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, and Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses applicants must not exceed 28 years of age; PhD Programs applicants must not exceed 30 years of age. A general minimum age of 18 years is implied. Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application, unless they are Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Demonstrated knowledge of either Italian or English is required, depending on the language of instruction for the chosen program. This scholarship is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including regional DSU (Diritto allo Studio Universitario) scholarships. Applicants must choose between the MAECI grant and any other Italian public funding.
Eligible_Fields: All fields, Music, Theater Arts, Linguistics
Eligible_Field_Group: All fields, ARTS & DESIGN, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not explicitly required, but relevant research experience or a strong academic background in the chosen field would be beneficial for PhD programs and research under academic supervision.
Language_Certificate: Italian Language Proficiency: A2 Level (CEFR) for advanced Italian language and culture courses; B2 Level (CEFR) for Italian-taught degree programs. English Language Proficiency: B2 Level (CEFR) for English-taught degree programs.
Age: Minimum 18 years. Maximum: 23 for Bachelor’s, 28 for Master’s/AFAM/Language, 30 for PhD.
Special_Circumstances: Open to foreign citizens not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution.
Other_Requirements: Admission Letter: For PhD programs, applicants are generally required to provide a letter of acceptance or admission from the relevant Italian university or institute. Securing pre-acceptance from an Italian institution is highly recommended for all applicants. Personal Statement: A personal statement, typically maximum 1000 words, outlining motivation and academic goals, is a required application document. Reference Letters: While not always listed as mandatory, recommendation letters are considered during the selection process. Motivation: Applicants' motivation for studying in Italy and pursuing their chosen field is a significant selection criterion.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as MAECI Grants, is a prestigious program offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). Its primary objective is to foster international cultural, scientific, and technological cooperation, promote the Italian language and culture worldwide, and support Italy’s economic system. The scholarship enables foreign citizens not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE) to pursue higher education, research, and language studies in Italy. The program aims to strengthen academic cooperation and allow students to experience Italy's rich academic and cultural heritage.
Application_Documents:
*   Score statement/academic transcripts.
*   Admission letter from the Italian university/institute (especially for PhD programs).
*   A personal statement (maximum 1000 words).
*   Certificate of Italian or English language proficiency (if applicable).
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV).
*   Other documents as specified in the official call for applications.
Timeline:
April : Application Opening Date (typically, April 2025 for 2025-2026 academic year)
May 16, 2025, 2 p.m. (CET) : Application Deadline (for 2025-2026 academic year)
January to September : 3-month scholarships (for advanced Italian language and culture courses)
November to July : 6-9 month scholarships (for degree programs)

Funding_Details:
TIPP offers fully funded scholarships for international students pursuing Master's degrees in leading Thai universities. The scholarship covers significant expenses, including:
* Accommodation Allowance: A monthly stipend ranging from 7,000 to 9,000 Baht, depending on the study location.
However, awardees are responsible for certain costs:
* Travel Insurance: Awardees must obtain their own travel insurance, which should fully cover any costs arising from loss or theft of personal belongings.
* Visa Application Costs: All expenses related to the visa application process, such as visa fees, travel costs to the Royal Thai Embassy/Consulate, postal fees (if applying by post), and transit visa fees (if required for a transit country), must be covered by the awardees.
Quantity: Over 70 postgraduate scholarships; up to 5 candidates per course/academic year per eligible country/territory.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The TIPP scholarship is open to international students from developing countries, including specific OIC member states. Candidates must meet the following stringent requirements:
* Nomination: Applicants must be officially nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or relevant central government agencies for which they currently work.
* Employment: Candidates must be working in the government sector or in areas directly related to the course they intend to pursue.
* Work Experience: A minimum of three years of work experience with the nominating agency is required at the time of application.
* Academic Background: Applicants must hold a Bachelor’s degree and/or possess professional experience in a field related to their chosen graduate degree.
* Language Proficiency: A good command of English is essential, demonstrated by an English score (e.g., TOEFL/IELTS) or other relevant language certificates.
* Age Limit: Candidates must be no more than 45 years of age.
* Health: Applicants must be in good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant.
* Country-Specific Requirements:
    * Civil servants must fulfill all relevant criteria prescribed in BCSR 2023 (Bhutan Civil Service Rules) in addition to the scholarship guidelines.
    * Applicants outside civil service (e.g., Corporate, Private Sector, NGO) must fulfill all relevant criteria prescribed by the Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD (Ministry of Education and Skills Development) in addition to the scholarship guidelines.
Eligible_Fields: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agricultural Sciences, Food Security, Climate Change, Environmental Science, Environmental Management, Environmental Governance, Sustainable Development, Agribusiness, Other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Eligible_Field_Group: INTERDISCIPLINARY & SPECIALIZED, HEALTH & MEDICINE, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS
Experience_Years: A minimum of three years of work experience with the nominating agency
Language_Certificate: TOEFL/IELTS or other relevant language certificates
Age: No more than 45 years of age
Special_Circumstances: Must be in good physical and mental condition; must not be pregnant.
Other_Requirements: A minimum of three recommendation letters are required as part of the application.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a prestigious scholarship initiative officially provided by the Government of Thailand, specifically through the Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA), in collaboration with various Thai Universities and Academic Institutions. Launched in 2000, TIPP serves as a framework for offering postgraduate scholarships to individuals from other developing countries. The program aims to share Thailand’s best practices and experiences, build global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and allow participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and warm hospitality. All studies under this program are conducted in Thailand.
Application_Documents:
* Two completed hard copies of the application form (downloadable from the Ministry's website or TICA portal).
* Recommendation letters (at least three).
* English score (e.g., TOEFL/IELTS).
* Thesis proposal or other documents as requested by the specific university.
* List of TIPP courses.
* Scholarship guidelines.
* List of eligible countries/territories.
* Online application forms may also be available (e.g., via Google Forms).
Timeline:
January 10, 2025 : Opening Date
January 15, 2025 : Internal deadline for submission to Ministry of Education/Scholarship Desk (e.g., for Grenada)
January 31, 2025 : Application Deadline for submission to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate General
Ongoing : Candidates are nominated by their National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation or relevant central government agencies.
Ongoing : National Focal Point forwards nominated candidates’ documents to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate General.
Ongoing : Application procedure considered complete when TICA receives hard copies via Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate General.
